Ooaman

I thought this would be fun. If you had at Time Machine and the ability to go to any date at all that you wanted to go and anythig you did would not effedct the timeline, what day, month, and/or year would you go and why?
 
 
 For me, some of my choices are...
 October 31, 1939 - I always wondered what it would be like to hear the original radio broadcast of War Of The Worlds
 1976 - I would like to pick up one of the first copies of Boston's Boston.
 October 1985, early part - I was too young to actually remember seeing the Kansas City Royals win the world series.
 Mid to late October 2001 in Arizona - I'd like to see the Yankees loose their first World Series in a long time like they did that year.
 October last year in St. Louis, just so I could see the Boston Red Sox win the world series in person. (Have I mentioned that I like Baseball.) That's just a few.
 
 
 
 So, do I have any takers?
Bassman
If I had a TARDIS (yes, I confess, I'm a Doctor Who fan), I would go back to a time where the moral climate in America was better.

If I had a TARDIS (yes, I confess, I'm a Doctor Who fan), I would go back to a time where the moral climate in America was better.

 Yes, back to the good ole days when men were men and stayed in the closet where they belong. Where women were women and stayed in the kitchen where they belong. When children took a beating like a man. Oh yes, I'd like to be back there too.

Being the history lover that I am, there are loads of things I'd like to go back and see, but the first thing that comes to my mind is to go back and see the life of Jesus, so I could know what really happened and in full.
 I'll mention others as they come to me.

 Actually, this being the first full day of Fall, I'm thinking it would be fun to go back to days of the early classic horror films. When the old Dracula, Frankenstein, and the Wolf-Man were actually scarry.

I'd go back to the day I lost my virginity.. I'd like to tell myself some of the things I know now!
